name: InterContinental Century City Hotel Chengdu

reviews.text: Very high standards (especially considering that we are in China). Rooms are spacious and cleaned, fully equipped. Staff is efficient and kind, also not very common in China.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in ChengDu

reviews.text: I haven't tried any food there, so cannot guarantee about its quality.
reviews.title: Exceptional service and abundant staff

reviews.text: I stayed at this Hotel along with a tourism industrry delegation of 100+ from Australia in March. The hotel also hosted 100+ travel industrry delegates from all parts of China at the same function, over three days of workshops held in the Hotel's function rooms.
reviews.title: Excellent Property But No Air Conditioning

reviews.text: The co-ordination by hotel management of the function over 3 days could not be faulted. Brilliant ergonomics for presentaions and breakout requirements. Mass lunches and dinners were cartered for exceptionally well with more than adequate, well skilled, staff on hand.
reviews.title: Magnificent blue

reviews.text: I was pleased with the deluxe room on level 23. It was requested and supplied as a high level room based on Tripadvisor tips and correctly so.
reviews.title: Huge - lobby and area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before I write anything about the Hotel please contact Giulio Martinatto (Guest Relations Manager) and James (Concierge) for anything and everything you want in Intercon. We couldn't have got a better person to help us with facilities, food (we are vegetarians) and transportation. Extremely patient and friendly.
reviews.title: Just Perfect !!

reviews.text: We stayed in the Hotel only for a day first and then on return from Jiuzhai for 2 days.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, but...

reviews.text: We were upgraded to a better room and treated really well. We had odd flight timings and Giulio made sure we get packed breakfast at 4 in the morning. Well trained staff, beautiful deco and ambience. Communication is always problem in China but both of them made sure we had Travel cards of Hotel with us where ever we wanted to go.
reviews.title: Very, Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: James suggested a Vegetarian place (Vegetarian Life Style - Separate review) after my husband exchanged 40 odd e-mails with him. It was out of the world dining and all credit goes to James.
reviews.title: good hotel, but room for improvement

reviews.text: Hotel Rooms were fantastic. I was celebrating my B'day and when we got back to Hotel we had a surprise gift (panda teddy) and huge cake waiting in the room.
reviews.title: Nice experience

reviews.text: The lobby was beautiful. Nearby restaurants were convenient.
reviews.title: Bait and switch

reviews.text: We had reserved 3 non-smoking kings and were given three smoking rooms in which they had sprayed air freshener and then placed electric incense burners to cover the odor. The scent was cloying to the point of being being noxious.
reviews.title: Top property

reviews.text: A neat plastic no smoking sign was placed beside the ashtray on the coffee table. Complaints to the front office were unreturned.
reviews.title: Very average

reviews.text: The rooms in the hotel, on the executive floor, do not have adjustable temperature so despite turning the heat down on the room control, the room maintained a temperature of over 80 degrees for the length of my stay. The other two rooms had the same issue.
reviews.title: lovely stay
Nice hotel
reviews.text: Finally, there is road construction going on beside the hotel. This is not the fault of the hotel. However combined with the poor hardware and service the excessive noise was both disruptive and unpleasant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although along way south of the city centre in a new area near the exhibition and conference centre, this is one of the best and most comfortable hotels in China, fully living up to the Intercon standard.
reviews.title: One of the best and most comfortable hotels in China

reviews.text: The lobby is tastefully grand, with a Chengdu Tea House style, reception is efficient and friendly and the rooms are large, comfortable and well furnished equipped with DVD player, Ipod dock and stereo system. The glass walled bathroom is large, with free standing tub, separate shower, separate WC and automatic blinds for privacy. A nice touch is the incense burner lamp with a choice of fragrances
reviews.title: Perfect decor. Perfect location for business.

reviews.text: Breakfast has a wide choice of well presented and comprehensive selection of western and Chinese dishes。Service is generally excellent, efficient and friendly, mostly with good english.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel

reviews.text: Overlooking what is quite possibly the largest building in the world, and a riverside park in the making, the hotel is within walking distance of the n-s metro line, approx. 30minutes to the city centre and a similar drive time to airport and the panda base. In the immediate environs of the hotel is an instant “ancient” village, with an array of stone houses and narrow laneways, mostly still awaiting tenants, although there are several flourishing restaurants, including a branch of Sunxing, a famous Sichuan restaurant styled as a Chengdu tea house with nightly face changing and Sichuan opera performances.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with good services

reviews.text: In short, if you don’t need to be in the city centre and want a comfortable modern place to stay, the Intercon at Century City is quite possibly the best choice.
reviews.title: " Keep going on "

description: Combining the best of European tradition and Chinese warmth, the InterContinental Century City Chengdu stands out as an exciting new landmark in the capital of Sichuan province. The hotel offers a full range of guestrooms and suites, an array of excellent restaurant and lounge offerings, a stylish Spa and first-class event and business facilities. Serving as an ideal venue for the business traveller in Chengdu, the hotel is within walking distance of the Chengdu International Exhibition Centre and a 20-minute drive from the airport.
